body_html: @ezyang But even if there is really a bug, there are so few options that we can choose. The first one is to update the MSVC compiler, but CUDA 9 only works well with v19.11. That is to say, there's only one version we can try (Build Tools 19.11.25547, VS 15.4.5). The second one is to count the problem on the CUDA side. But I don't think it's a good idea to throw away support for CUDA 9.

body: @ezyang But even if there is really a bug, there are so few options that we can choose. The first one is to update the MSVC compiler, but CUDA 9 only works well with v19.11. That is to say, there's only one version we can try (Build Tools 19.11.25547, VS 15.4.5). The second one is to count the problem on the CUDA side. But I don't think it's a good idea to throw away support for CUDA 9.
